required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Contrast Enhancement Boost for the Direct Identification of Pulmonary Emboli in Thoracic CT Angiography
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Contrast Enhancement Boost for the Direct Identification of Pulmonary Emboli in Thoracic CT Angiography

brief_summary.textblock:
Pulmonary embolism is a common cardiovascular disease and thoracic CT angiography is currently considered the gold standard for its non-invasive diagnosis. However, the diagnostic performance of CT angiography can be hampered by an insufficient enhancement of pulmonary arteries. Contrast Enhancement Boost (CE Boost) is a post-processing technique using an iodine density map to artificially improve pulmonary artery enhancement.
This retrospective study compares standard CT-angiography images with CE Boost images to assess the potential improvement of diagnostic performance for the detection of pulmonary embolism.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of thrombi within each branch of the pulmonary arteries
primary_outcome.description: The pulmonary arteries were divided into 11 zones according to their anatomical characteristics then each visible thrombus was reported in a Excel table according to the zone where it was located

arm_group.description: Patients with pulmonary embolism on thoracic CT angiography
Patients without pulmonary embolism on thoracic CT angiography

intervention.description: Contrast Enhancement Boost is a post-processing technique that uses an iodine density map generated by subtracting a pre- and post-contrast CT acquisition to artificially enhance pulmonary artery enhancement.

study_pop.textblock: Patient referred in our institution by emergency practitioners who underwent thoracic CT angiography for clinical suspicion of pulmonary embolism between March and June 2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient who underwent thoracic CT angiography for suspicion of pulmonary embolism in our institution between March and June 2018
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
